titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Mary Katharine Woodworth (1900-1988), was a graduate of Bryn Mawr College and taught English there from 1935-1964. While at Bryn Mawr she cultivated relationships with many of the century's foremost authors, bringing several of them to Bryn Mawr for readings and lectures.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the personal and professional papers of Mary Katharine Woodworth. Materials include: correspondence with her family and friends; travel journals; correspondence with many authors, poets and artists; scrapbooks, papers, notebooks and report cards from the high school and college careers of Woodworth and her sister Allegra; notes, transcriptions and drafts for a biography of William Hayley; photographs and negatives; and legal and financial records. The collection also includes a small number of materials documenting the life of Woodworth's mother, Elizabeth.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Allegra Woodworth papers.
